FuncDef:
The poison-reverse enable command enables IP FRR poison reverse.
The undo poison-reverse enable command disables IP FRR poison reverse.
By default, IP FRR poison reverse is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On an IP ring network with IP FRR, the poison-reverse enable command is used to prevent instantaneous traffic storms caused by the route convergence. For configurations details, see Configuration-BGP/MPLS IP VPN Configuration-Configuring Private Network IP FRR.
Configuration Impact
After you enable poison reverse, inter-VLAN proxy ARP does not take effect.
Precautions
In load balancing scenarios, poison reverse does not take effect.
